content:
• Wednesday, May 2, 2012

    Newport (NASDAQ:NEWP): Q1 EPS of $0.17 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.20. Revenue of...

    Newport (NASDAQ:NEWP): Q1 EPS of $0.17 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.20. Revenue of $157M (+22.4% Y/Y) misses by $4M. Shares -14.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:46 PM
  • GOOG

    More on ValueClick's Q1: The company is guiding for Q2 revenue of $155M-$160M, below a $167.9M...

    More on ValueClick's Q1: The company is guiding for Q2 revenue of $155M-$160M, below a $167.9M consensus. Affiliate marketing revenue is expected to be up only in the mid-single-digits Y/Y, while revenue from owned/operated sites is expected to fall at a high-teens rate. ValueClick appears to be losing share to Google (NASDAQ:GOOG) in the display ad space. VCLK -16.5% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:06 PM

    Western Gas Partners (NYSE:WES): Q1 EPS of $0.48 in-line. Revenue of $212.2M (+17.4% Y/Y)....

    Ion Geophysical (NYSE:IO): Q1 EPS of $0.05 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $111.7M (+23.3% Y/Y) beats by $1.2M. Shares +4.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM

    Endurance Specialty Ltd (NYSE:ENH): Q1 EPS of $1.72 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.92....

    Endurance Specialty Ltd (NYSE:ENH): Q1 EPS of $1.72 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.92. Shares +1.1% AH. (PR)

    Energy XXI (Bermuda) (EXXI): FQ3 EPS of $1.04 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $336M (+29.9% Y/Y)...

    Energy XXI (Bermuda) (EXXI): FQ3 EPS of $1.04 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $336M (+29.9% Y/Y) misses by $6M. Shares -2.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:19 PM | 3 Comments
  • APKT

    Down initially after posting its Q1 report, Acme Packet (NASDAQ:APKT) is now up 12.3% AH after...

    Down initially after posting its Q1 report, Acme Packet (NASDAQ:APKT) is now up 12.3% AH after stating on its earnings call (webcast) it still expects 10% revenue growth in 2012. That's only slightly above a consensus of 9.6%, but as the recent performance of its shares demonstrates, many have been assuming the worst on account of soft capex from U.S. service providers.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:17 PM
  • PRU

    More on Prudential (NYSE:PRU): The company lost $988M for the quarter, thanks to a $1.5B hit on...

    More on Prudential (NYSE:PRU): The company lost $988M for the quarter, thanks to a $1.5B hit on what appears to be a yen currency hedge gone wrong. Insurance premiums of $6.1B, +26.6% Y/Y, Net investment income +9.9% Y/Y, Asset management fees -9.9% Y/Y. Shares -5.6% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:07 PM
  • CENT

    Central Garden & Pet (NASDAQ:CENT): FQ2 EPS of $0.45 misses by $0.09. Revenue of $467M...

    Central Garden & Pet (NASDAQ:CENT): FQ2 EPS of $0.45 misses by $0.09. Revenue of $467M (-3.9% Y/Y) misses by $35M. Shares -8.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:05 PM
  • CALD

    Callidus Software (NASDAQ:CALD): Q1 EPS of -$0.03 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $22M (+11.1% Y/Y)...

    Callidus Software (NASDAQ:CALD): Q1 EPS of -$0.03 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $22M (+11.1% Y/Y) misses by $0.6M. Shares +2.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:02 PM
  • GMCR

    More on Green Mountain Coffee Roaster's (NASDAQ:GMCR) FQ2: While sales moved up 37%, inventory...

    More on Green Mountain Coffee Roaster's (NASDAQ:GMCR) FQ2: While sales moved up 37%, inventory skyrocketed 100% on lower demand for K-cup packs. Gross margin falls to 35.4% on higher coffee costs, from 37.5% a year ago. Sees "more moderated" growth path for both Keurig brewer and K-pack sales. Guides Q3 EPS to $0.48-0.53 vs $0.72 consensus and Q3 revenue to $861-897M vs $1.05B. Shares -38.9% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:55 PM | 5 Comments
  • HTZ

    Hertz Global Holdings (NYSE:HTZ): Q1 EPS of $0.05 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $1.66B (+10.2% Y/Y)...

    Hertz Global Holdings (NYSE:HTZ): Q1 EPS of $0.05 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $1.66B (+10.2% Y/Y) misses by $300M. Shares +2.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:52 PM
  • JVA

    Shares of Coffee Holding (NASDAQ:JVA) shed 6.6% in AH trading after Green Mountain Coffee...

    Shares of Coffee Holding (NASDAQ:JVA) shed 6.6% in AH trading after Green Mountain Coffee reports slowing sales. With no news out it looks like investors of JVA are spooked by GMCR basically admitting that it's no longer a growth story.<
     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM
  • CNVR

    ValueClick (VCLK): Q1 EPS of $0.38 beats by $0.15. Revenue of $152.9M (+31.2% Y/Y) misses by...

    ValueClick (VCLK): Q1 EPS of $0.38 beats by $0.15. Revenue of $152.9M (+31.2% Y/Y) misses by $5M. Shares -12.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM
  • YELP

    Yelp (NYSE:YELP): Q1 EPS of -$0.31 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $27.4M (+66% Y/Y) beats by $2.1M....

    Yelp (NYSE:YELP): Q1 EPS of -$0.31 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $27.4M (+66% Y/Y) beats by $2.1M. Expects Q2 revenue of $29M-$31M, largely above $29M consensus. Expects 2012 revenue of $128M-$132M, above $124.4M consensus. YELP +3.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM
  • ALL

    Allstate (NYSE:ALL): Q1 EPS of $1.53 beats by $0.43. Revenue of $8.36B (+2.8% Y/Y) beats by $2B....

    Allstate (NYSE:ALL): Q1 EPS of $1.53 beats by $0.43. Revenue of $8.36B (+2.8% Y/Y) beats by $2B. Shares +3.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM
  • Z

    Zillow (NASDAQ:Z): Q1 EPS of $0.06 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $22.8M (+103% Y/Y) beats by $1.3M....

    Zillow (NASDAQ:Z): Q1 EPS of $0.06 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $22.8M (+103% Y/Y) beats by $1.3M. Expects Q2 revenue of $25.5M-$26.5M, above $24.8M consensus. Company is also acquiring RentJuice, a developer of rental management software for property owners, for $40M in cash. Z +6.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM | 1 Comment
  • APKT

    Acme Packet (NASDAQ:APKT): Q1 EPS of $0.17 in-line. Revenue of $70.8M (-4.3% Y/Y) beats by...

    Acme Packet (NASDAQ:APKT): Q1 EPS of $0.17 in-line. Revenue of $70.8M (-4.3% Y/Y) beats by $1.6M. Shares -2.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (NASDAQ:GMCR) resumes trading down 33.1% AH after reporting weak...

    Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (NASDAQ:GMCR) resumes trading down 33.1% AH after reporting weak revenue for FQ2 and lowering its guidance mark for full-year results.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM | 12 Comments
  • VIAV

    More on JDS Uniphase's FQ3: The company blames later-than-expected carrier orders and macro...

    More on JDS Uniphase's FQ3: The company blames later-than-expected carrier orders and macro issues for its top-line weakness. Spending cuts allowed earnings to meet estimates. Gross margin fell 130 bps Q/Q and 210 bps Y/Y to 45.5%. Telecom optical component sales +3.7% Q/Q but -22.5% Y/Y. Commercial lasers were strong, +19% Q/Q and +21% Y/Y. JDSU -4.8% AH. FNSR -3.5%. OCLR -1%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • PRU

    Prudential Financial (NYSE:PRU): Q1 EPS of $1.56 misses by $0.15. Revenue of $10.7B (+16.4% Y/Y)...

    Prudential Financial (NYSE:PRU): Q1 EPS of $1.56 misses by $0.15. Revenue of $10.7B (+16.4% Y/Y) beats by $0.3M. Shares -5.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM | 13 Comments
  • CBT

    Cabot (CBT +4%) shares hit a 52-week high as FQ2 profit surged past expectations, and core...

    Cabot (CBT +4%) shares hit a 52-week high as FQ2 profit surged past expectations, and core earnings rose due to higher pricing for its primary product. Also, CBT received its first payment for the sale of a major business. The chemical and specialty materials company says it can meet its long-term financial targets of $4.50 adjusted EPS in 2014 with adjusted return on invested capital over 13%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • ARCH

    Fitch cuts its credit rating on Arch Coal (ACI -7.2%) further into junk territory, citing weak...

    Fitch cuts its credit rating on Arch Coal (ACI -7.2%) further into junk territory, citing weak demand for domestic steam coal and high debt levels. The move comes a day after ACI reported Q1 earnings plunged on weaker than expected demand and higher operating costs; ACI also plans to refinance its debt through a new $1B term loan with no financial maintenance covenants.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:50 PM | 2 Comments
  • ENDP

    Endo Pharmaceuticals (ENDP -1.4%) slips on a downgrade to Hold at Cantor earlier today, citing a...

    Endo Pharmaceuticals (ENDP -1.4%) slips on a downgrade to Hold at Cantor earlier today, citing a mediocre Q1 and saying it sees no reason to buy the stock ahead of the the pending Lidoderm settlement.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:37 PM
  • ANAD

    ANADIGICS (ANAD -2.8%) dips after missing on its Q1 EPS results late yesterday. Revenue dropped...

    ANADIGICS (ANAD -2.8%) dips after missing on its Q1 EPS results late yesterday. Revenue dropped 34% Y/Y as sales of its legacy products slowed more than anticipated. Craig-Hallum cut the shares to hold on the report, citing concerns over growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:23 PM
  • CHK

    Here's Chesapeake's (CHK -13.5%) conundrum: CHK has been touting its shift from natural gas to...

    Here's Chesapeake's (CHK -13.5%) conundrum: CHK has been touting its shift from natural gas to liquids as a way to overcome low natural gas prices, but its production of liquids is unimpressive so far. And weak nat gas prices make it more difficult to find the funds needed to drill the wells for producing the liquids. For today at least, this explains more of CHK's price swoon than McClendon's antics.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM | 7 Comments
  • WTS

    Watts Water Technologies (WTS -2.6%) slips after missing on its Q1 results late yesterday,...

    Watts Water Technologies (WTS -2.6%) slips after missing on its Q1 results late yesterday, despite posting better overall revenue. Sales increased 10% Y/Y, mostly from acquisitions, but were offset by higher expenses and lower operating margins.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:02 PM
  • HLF

    Herbalife (HLF -5.8%) reverses an early bounce following yesterday's plummet. It's a broken...

    Herbalife (HLF -5.8%) reverses an early bounce following yesterday's plummet. It's a broken momentum play, suggests Michael Davey, ignoring for a minute the Einhorn story, and just looking at the chart. He compares it to CROX, which years ago made an all-time high, gapped down the next day, and just kept sinking.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM | 3 Comments
  • CEVA

    Ceva (CEVA -18.3%), a developer of DSP cores used in mobile baseband chips from Broadcom, Intel,...

    Ceva (CEVA -18.3%), a developer of DSP cores used in mobile baseband chips from Broadcom, Intel, and others, is making new 52-week lows after issuing soft guidance to go with its Q1 beat. The company now expects 2012 revenue of $57.2M-$61.2M and EPS of $0.87-$0.99, below a consensus of $63.8M and $1.02. Ceva blames the impact of Nokia's plunging market share, which has also taken a toll on Texas Instruments' (NYSE:TXN) chip sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM
  • BCPC

    Balchem (BCPC +10.6%) flies higher after the company reports higher revenue and profit for Q1....

    Balchem (BCPC +10.6%) flies higher after the company reports higher revenue and profit for Q1. The nutrients maker was able to make up for higher raw material prices with strong sales of its industrial grade products.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:44 PM | 1 Comment
  • RBCN

    Even though fellow LED industry player Rubicon (RBCN -6.8%) is tanking due to its Q1/Q2 warning,...

    Even though fellow LED industry player Rubicon (RBCN -6.8%) is tanking due to its Q1/Q2 warning, Cree (CREE +2.5%) is rallying following its introduction of LED downlight products. Cree boasts its SR Series downlight uses 85% less energy than incandescent alternatives, and that its KR Series is price-competitive with fluorescent solutions.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM | 1 Comment
  • CLW

    Clearwater Paper (CLW +6.9%) rallies after Steven Cohen's SAC Capital discloses in an SEC filing...

    Clearwater Paper (CLW +6.9%) rallies after Steven Cohen's SAC Capital discloses in an SEC filing a 7.2% stake and a letter sent to the company’s board. CLW is “deeply undervalued," the letter says, and a sum of the parts valuation of the tissue and paperboard product maker is much higher than its current share price but is weighed down by its combinations.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:08 PM
  • ENR

    Energizer Holdings (ENR +8.5%) trades higher today after beating FQ2 estimates this morning. Net...

    Energizer Holdings (ENR +8.5%) trades higher today after beating FQ2 estimates this morning. Net profit nearly doubled on better pricing strategies out of its houshold products division and strong sales from its Hydro franchise. The company also initiated a $0.40 quarterly dividend program and authorizes a 10M share stock buy back program.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM
  • MCHP

    Microchip (MCHP -0.7%) is only off slightly following its deal to acquire fellow microcontroller...

    Microchip (MCHP -0.7%) is only off slightly following its deal to acquire fellow microcontroller vendor Standard Microsystems (SMSC +38.4%). Likely helping is Microchip's forecast the deal will be accretive in its first full quarter after completion. Capstone's Jeff Schreiner thinks Microchip may be trying to strengthen its position in the growing automotive microcontroller market. Rivals Atmel (ATML +1.6%) and Freescale (FSL +1.8%) are rallying a little.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM
  • FB

    Two favorites of Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) IPO speculators, the Firsthand Technology Value Fund (SVVC...

    Two favorites of Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) IPO speculators, the Firsthand Technology Value Fund (SVVC +5.1%) and GSV Capital (GSVC +7.5%), are rallying after its was reported that Facebook would launch its road show on Monday and plans to begin trading on May 18. In addition, Firsthand has announced it has made a $1.8M investment in Twitter.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM | 2 Comments
  • MSCI

    MSCI (MSCI -3.7%) slips after missing Q1 estimates earlier today. Net profit actually rose 31%...

    MSCI (MSCI -3.7%) slips after missing Q1 estimates earlier today. Net profit actually rose 31% Y/Y on better revenue growth from subscriptions and expanded offerings, and a bounce in asset-based fees as global equity markets strengthened.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:44 PM
  • UBNT

    Ubiquiti Networks (UBNT -15.8%), which closed yesterday near its 52-week high, is tumbling after...

    Ubiquiti Networks (UBNT -15.8%), which closed yesterday near its 52-week high, is tumbling after its Q1 results and in-line Q2 guidance (revenue of $93M-$95M and EPS of $0.28-$0.29 vs. consensus of $93.9M and $0.28) fail to impress. Wunderlich and Raymond James have downgraded the company in response. Also, on Monday, a Chinese report claimed CEO Robert Pera is using local mafia ties to quash competition.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:39 PM | 2 Comments
  • SNBR

    Select Comfort (SCSS +5.1%) trades higher after SAC Capital discloses in a 13G filing that it...

    Select Comfort (SCSS +5.1%) trades higher after SAC Capital discloses in a 13G filing that it raised its stake in the firm to over 5% from a small position held at the end of 2011. Mattress company stocks have been one of the hottest groups in 2012 - with analysts calling for even more upside as a paradigm shift in how consumers relate bedding products to health benefits is viewed as taking hold. YTD: SCSS +42.5%, TPX +16.9%, ZZ +13.6%, MFRM +75.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:36 PM
  • CALX

    Broadband infrastructure vendor Calix (CALX +18.4%), which had fallen sharply from last summer's...

    Broadband infrastructure vendor Calix (CALX +18.4%), which had fallen sharply from last summer's levels on telecom capex fears, soars after delivering a better-than-feared Q1 report and forecasting a 2H pickup in demand. Calix, which is hoping to get a lift from the FCC's Connect America Fund, also announced it has been chosen to support 5 new broadband stimulus projects.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:26 PM
  • DCIX

    Diana Containerships (DCIX +13.4%) soars after reporting improved profits in Q1 and upping its...

    Diana Containerships (DCIX +13.4%) soars after reporting improved profits in Q1 and upping its dividend by 67% to $0.25/share. The company says 4 new vessels will start kicking in full to results in Q2 and could lead to another dividend boost.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:08 PM | 1 Comment
  • HOTT

    Shares of Hot Topic (HOTT +5.3%) run up after B. Riley identifies the company as an attractive...

    Shares of Hot Topic (HOTT +5.3%) run up after B. Riley identifies the company as an attractive buyout candidate. The firm's market cap of $437M sits right in what has become a sweet spot for M&A deals.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM
  • ROVI

    Rovi (ROVI -1.7%) says it's suing Mitsubishi Electric, accusing the company of infringing on its...

    Rovi (ROVI -1.7%) says it's suing Mitsubishi Electric, accusing the company of infringing on its patented digital TV-guide technology.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:54 PM
  • REXX

    Rexx Energy (REXX +3%) is one of few energy stocks on the rise today after reporting Q1...

    Rexx Energy (REXX +3%) is one of few energy stocks on the rise today after reporting Q1 production exceeded its highest-case guidance and increasing its outlook for full-year production. Daily production rates rose 23% Q/Q.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM
  • MTOR

    Meritor (MTOR +4.5%) moves up after its FQ2 beat estimates earlier today. Net earnings rose 18%...

    Meritor (MTOR +4.5%) moves up after its FQ2 beat estimates earlier today. Net earnings rose 18% Y/Y despite a slight dip in revenue, as the company logged higher sales growth on a rebound in North American and European auto demand and fewer charges after its restructuring.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM -5.5%) sees more pain on the second day of its BlackBerry World...

    Research In Motion (RIMM -5.5%) sees more pain on the second day of its BlackBerry World conference - reviews for the first day were largely downbeat. Among today's critics are Wedge Partners, which thinks BlackBerry 10 is arriving 3 years too late to matter, and Jefferies, which expects a collapse in BB7 sales ahead of BB10's launch. Meanwhile, RIM is touting the BlackBerry's strength in emerging markets such as Nigeria and Indonesia. (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM | 3 Comments
  • GOLD

    Barrick Gold (ABX -2.7%) shares slump after the world's largest gold miner reported Q1 earnings...

    Barrick Gold (ABX -2.7%) shares slump after the world's largest gold miner reported Q1 earnings that rose 3% on higher gold prices. ABX gold production fell 4% to 1.88M oz., and expects production to decrease further in Q2 due to mine maintenance but to increase in H2 as new mines begin production.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM | 4 Comments
  • YELP

    Eric Jackson says he's long Yelp (YELP +3.8%) heading into today's earnings report, it's first...

    Eric Jackson says he's long Yelp (YELP +3.8%) heading into today's earnings report, it's first as a public company. Among his reasons: the company is growing quickly, its data on small businesses is increasingly valuable, its services are a natural fit for mobile devices, and the company is an attractive M&A candidate.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM
  • PLX

    Canaccord takes some of the shine off Protalix's (PLX +13%) early morning 27% run-up in the wake...

    Canaccord takes some of the shine off Protalix's (PLX +13%) early morning 27% run-up in the wake of the FDA's approval of its new treatment for Gaucher disease, downgrading the shares to Hold after digging deeper into the report. The firm says it sees only modest U.S. but solid Israel/ROW potential, and EU approval may in fact be blocked.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM
  • MRO

    Marathon Oil (MRO -4.3%) shares slide after Q1 earnings missed estimates, tumbling 58% from a...

    Marathon Oil (MRO -4.3%) shares slide after Q1 earnings missed estimates, tumbling 58% from a year-earlier period that included contributions from its former refining and marketing business, and as the E&P company posted lower sales volumes. MRO increased its forecast for 2012 capex spending to $5B from its prior estimate of $4.8B.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:12 PM
  • OPEN

    PTs for OpenTable (OPEN -16.1%) are falling post-earnings, thanks to the company's disappointing...

    PTs for OpenTable (OPEN -16.1%) are falling post-earnings, thanks to the company's disappointing revenue guidance, soft international sales, and weak restaurant adds. BofA (Neutral) is worried OpenTable's tech spending might be too low, but thinks an upcoming re-launch of the company's U.K. service could give it a lift. Benchmark (Buy) notes management has typically been conservative with its outlook.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM | 1 Comment
  • AMZN

    Amazon (AMZN +0.2%) announces that Amazon Studios will expand its efforts to develop comedy and...

    Amazon (AMZN +0.2%) announces that Amazon Studios will expand its efforts to develop comedy and kids shows with an online initiative that allows budding producers to submit their content and earn royalties. Unlike most Hollywood decision-making, crowdsourcing will be used to determine which Amazon shows are greenlighted.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM | 1 Comment
  • AUY

    Yamana Gold's (AUY -2.5%) Q1 profit rose 15% as improved average realized prices for gold and...

    Yamana Gold's (AUY -2.5%) Q1 profit rose 15% as improved average realized prices for gold and higher production boosted revenue. But input costs increased, and revenue was well below market expectations. Production in 2012 is projected at 1.2M-1.3M GEO, and is targeted to a sustainable level of ~1.75M GEO by 2014.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM | 1 Comment
  • MAS

    Masco (MAS +2.9%) gets a boost from an upgrade to Sector Perform on valuation at RBC Capital...

    Masco (MAS +2.9%) gets a boost from an upgrade to Sector Perform on valuation at RBC Capital this morning, based on what it sees as a recovery taking place in the housing market. Other housing stocks also doing well this morning: PulteGroup (PHM +4.8%), Lennar (LEN +3.9%), DR Horton (DHI +3.5%), Toll Brothers (TOL +2.3%), KB Home (KBH +1.4%).
     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM
  • WU

    Shares of Western Union (WU -1.9%) trade lower after the company discloses that it received a...

    Shares of Western Union (WU -1.9%) trade lower after the company discloses that it received a subpoena from the DOJ over an investigation of one its former agents in California. Though both BofA and Citigroup say the impact to the company should be limited, until further details emerge the issue remains a bit of an overhang.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM
